result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11/12/15 or be deducted from 25% of prison wages.  If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in ay election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm Bernard Hagler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (19 pages) commencing AUGUST 13, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 11.12.15 or be deducted from 25% of prison wages, or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.12.15 or be deducted from 25% of prison wages, or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
Order to Produce for  Sentencing Hearing on August 13, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing May 4, 2015 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:
Brian Burke (Public Defender)
819 N 6th St 
9th Floor
Milwaukee, WI 53203-1601

Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 7. Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, and requests Status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in custody.  Ron Dague for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Paul Vento-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF2975 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  
Defendant Malcolm Bernard Hagler in custody.  
George David Kidd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
